title: Franzbrötchen
text:
“A Franzbrötchen is a small, sweet pastry baked with butter and cinnamon, similar to a cinnamon roll. Sometimes other ingredients are used as well, such as chocolate or raisins. It is a type of pastry commonly found in northern Germany, especially Hamburg, and it is usually served for breakfast, but is also enjoyed along with coffee and cake.”

Text from Wikipedia (licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 (CC BY-SA) license)

title: Franzbrötchen
text:
“A Franzbrötchen is a small, sweet pastry baked with butter and cinnamon, similar to a cinnamon roll. Sometimes other ingredients are used as well, such as chocolate or raisins. It is a type of pastry commonly found in northern Germany, especially Hamburg, and it is usually served for breakfast, but is also enjoyed along with coffee and cake.”

Text from Wikipedia (licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 (CC BY-SA) license)

title: Franzbrötchen
text:
Where?
“Where to find the best Franzbrötchen?” is probably the most hotly debated question in Hamburg.
Here are my top-three recommended places:

Die Kleine Konditorei
Bäckerei Hönig
Café Luise

title: Invictus Gym
text: Name: Invictus Gym Location: Hamburg-Bergedorf

title: Invictus Gym
text:
What´s special about this gym?

It’s a high-end gym with lots of bodybuilding pros training and coaching there
There you can find the best training equipment for bodybuilding-, powerlifting- or fitness-related goals
Usually the gym is quite empty and you have all the weights for yourself :-)
Sometimes you can pet the dogs Urmel and Emma that belong to the gym owner/staff members.

walk along the Nieuwe maas river.

go to visit Kijk-Kubus for cube houses.

title: Contributing to this project
text:
Thank you for your interest in contributing to this project!
Whether you’re fixing bugs, improving documentation, or adding new city recommendations, your input is greatly appreciated.
Please follow the guidelines below to contribute effectively.




To add a new entry to the repository, please follow these steps:

Navigate to the guide folder: Locate the /guide subfolder in the project directory.
Choose a city folder or create a new one: Inside the /guide folder, navigate to the city for which you would like to add an entry (e.g., hamburg). If the city does not yet exist, please create a new folder.
Create a new file: Create a new .qmd file within the city subfolder for your recommendation. To simplify this process, you can copy an existing entry file as a template or use the template.qmd file as a starting point.
Add your recommendation: Populate the new .qmd file with the details of your recommendation. Ensure that you follow the formatting and structure of existing entries for consistency.
Commit your changes:
Once you’ve added your recommendation, commit your changes with a meaningful commit message.





By contributing to this project, you agree that your contributions will be licensed under its MIT License.
Thank you for your contributions! Together, we can make this project even better.

title: Your recommendation goes here
text:
A detailed description of your recommendation goes here.
For example, you could describe more details of your recommendation and where to find it in the city.

title: Asian Restaurant
text:
Rotterdam is a pretty international city, featuring restaurants originating from all over the world. Below are some Asian restaurants that are quite popular among the Asians in the city.

Seoul Sista Seoul Sista is an all-you-can-eat Korean BBQ. Our Korean colleague said it’s ‘authentic enough’
Soju Bar Also a Korean restaurant but this time for fried chicken. It is said that their Bibimbap is great as well. Very popular
Le Souq Nice and authentic Lebanese restaurant that all my colleagues love :) They offer various sorts of appetizers/starters that you could explore all different flavors.

title: Landungsbrücken
text: Landungsbrücken (landing bridges) is a historic landing pier located along the Elbe River, near the famous Reeperbahn street.

title: Landungsbrücken
text: Landungsbrücken (landing bridges) is a historic landing pier located along the Elbe River, near the famous Reeperbahn street.

title: Landungsbrücken
text:
What to do?
Watching the sunset and hopping on a ferry are my favorite activities at Landungsbrücken. You can also visit museum ships, such as the Cap San Diego, via Landungsbrücken.

title: Alstercanals
text: Hamburg’s canals are among the most beautiful features of the city. Especially the Alster canals in Eppendorf and Winterhude offer beautiful views of impressive houses and scenic gardens. Among many options to cruise along the Alster canals, stand-up paddling is a fun way to explore alone or with friends.

title: Alstercanals

title: Alstercanals
text:
Where?
Due to its popularity, there are many SUP rentals in Hamburg. Just check out where you would like to start your tour and you’ll surely find a rental nearby!
Here are some of my favorite rental places:

SUP Legion
SUP Club
